title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 June 2009 - XWiki
content:
anamarias left at 00:02 () huubert joined #xwiki at 00:07 huubert - (29/06/2009 00:08): The default start page of a newly installed XWiki is a usability mess. sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:09): Hi huubert huubert - (29/06/2009 00:09): Is there a macro which prints out the pages inside the current space in a
    list? sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:10): You can do that with a velocity script huubert - (29/06/2009 00:10): How? sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:11):
      sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:11): #foreach($d in $xwiki.getSpaceDocsName('Space')) sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:11):   
    • $d
      • sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:11): #end sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:11):
    sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:11): Or using the wiki syntax: sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:11): #foreach($d in $xwiki.getSpaceDocsName('Space')) sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:11): \* $d sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:11): #end huubert - (29/06/2009 00:12): I thought something like a table of contents. sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:12): If you're using the 2.0 syntax, wrapped in {{velocity}} sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:12): What exactly do you need? huubert - (29/06/2009 00:17): This http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs?view=tree tree as a normal silly HTML markup hierarchical list. No unusable ajax tree thing. huubert - (29/06/2009 00:18): Meta+G is cool. But all users asks me "What is Meta?". huubert - (29/06/2009 00:18): I can't change the text "Jump to any page in the wiki (Meta+G)" cause it is not part of the edit this panel page. sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:20): It's in resources/js/xwiki/widgets/jumpToPage.js sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:21): It's not localized yet huubert - (29/06/2009 00:22): The top menu panel is flickering whenever I scroll. sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:22): Yes, that's a Firefox bug triggered by our skin sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:22): It's a known issue huubert - (29/06/2009 00:23): Fix it! huubert - (29/06/2009 00:23): :-) huubert - (29/06/2009 00:23): It's the user interface. huubert - (29/06/2009 00:23): The user. huubert - (29/06/2009 00:26): In some older XWiki version, the right menu was on the left side. And there was a simple navigation panel which allows me the navigate through the spaces. Space -> Page -> Sub page -> Sub page. Is this navigation panel still there? sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:28): Yes, use the panel wizard to find it huubert - (29/06/2009 00:30): There is a "Recently Created" and "Recently Modified" panel. Is there also a "Recently Changed" panel which contains recently modified and recently created pages? sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:31): If it's no sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:31): If it's not in the panel list, then no sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:31): The panel list is in the Panels/ space sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:32): But Recently Modified already does that sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:32): It lists both new old documents huubert - (29/06/2009 00:34): I am complaining a lot. Sorry for that. :-) huubert - (29/06/2009 00:34): But XWiki is really cool. huubert - (29/06/2009 00:34): Only the standard user interface is a little bit confusing. sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:36): Yes, we're trying to improve it this summer sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:36): If you have any particular suggestions, please report them on jira.xwiki.org or on the mailing list sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:36): Feedback is always welcome huubert - (29/06/2009 00:38): I have a ParentPage and a ChildPage. The ChildPage is a child of the ParentPage. In the Navigation panel the ChildPage is not listed under the ParentPage. sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:38): You can vote for http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XSTOUCAN-9 sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:39): Yes, the Navigation Panel lists flat spaces huubert - (29/06/2009 00:41): Any other panel which shows it hierarchical? huubert - (29/06/2009 00:42): The page structure. huubert - (29/06/2009 00:42): The page hierarchy structure. huubert - (29/06/2009 00:44): Removing "position: fixed;" from the CSS of the #actionmenu stops the flickering. sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:46): Yes, but the menu doesn't stay in place anymore sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:46): It's supposed to be accessible without having to scroll up huubert - (29/06/2009 00:51): Opera don't have this flickering problem. It's scrolls super smooth. :-) huubert - (29/06/2009 00:52): Really cool. huubert - (29/06/2009 00:53): The SpaceIndex http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/SpaceIndex?space=Main is also a flat list? sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:53): Yes, the only one with this problem is Firefox on Linux sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:53): Yes huubert - (29/06/2009 00:57): Is this http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/AllDocs table widget a third party JavaScript library? sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:57): No sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:57): It uses a library, but it's custom code sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:58): Anyway, the code that generates the tree structure is in the wiki sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:58): Just that it's not used sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:58): I have to sleep now sdumitriu - (29/06/2009 00:58): Bye sdumitriu left at 00:58 ("Leaving.") huubert left #xwiki at 00:58 Enygma` left at 02:15 ("Leaving.") arunreddy joined #xwiki at 06:22 mflorea joined #xwiki at 06:32 kaaloo joined #xwiki at 08:21 mflorea left at 08:26 ("Leaving") cristinaS joined #xwiki at 08:45 vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:48 vmassol left at 08:55 () j-saturne joined #xwiki at 08:55 venkatesh joined #xwiki at 08:56 vmassol joined #xwiki at 08:57 asyd - (29/06/2009 09:00): hello there mflorea joined #xwiki at 09:24 trifon joined #xwiki at 09:24 jvdrean joined #xwiki at 09:47 tmortagne joined #xwiki at 09:54 KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 10:05 jvelociter joined #xwiki at 10:11 glerouge joined #xwiki at 10:11 j-saturne left #xwiki at 10:45 cristinaS left at 11:07 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out)) sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 11:19 lucaa left at 11:20 ("Leaving.") anamarias joined #xwiki at 11:27 cristinaS joined #xwiki at 11:33 Enygma` joined #xwiki at 11:45 arunreddy\_ joined #xwiki at 11:56 venkatesh - (29/06/2009 11:56): Hi Enygma` Enygma` - (29/06/2009 11:57): hi venkatesh venkatesh - (29/06/2009 11:57): Hi, I implemented the xeclipse-part for moving/renaming attachment venkatesh - (29/06/2009 11:58): while actually running, I'm getting a xmlrpc error venkatesh - (29/06/2009 11:58): org.xwiki.eclipse.core.XWikiEclipseException: org.apache.xmlrpc.XmlRpcException: No such handler: confluence1.moveAttachment arunreddy\_ left at 11:58 (Read error: 54 (Connection reset by peer)) venkatesh - (29/06/2009 11:58): Full stack trace: - arunreddy\_ joined #xwiki at 11:59 venkatesh - (29/06/2009 11:59): http://venkatesh.pastebin.com/m6e50345f anamarias left at 12:00 () Enygma` - (29/06/2009 12:00): well, does the running XWiki have a patched version of the xmlrpc server side? One which has exposed a moveAttachment method? venkatesh - (29/06/2009 12:01): yes. venkatesh - (29/06/2009 12:02): I'm using the xwiki-core-\* jar that I created with modifed code. Enygma` - (29/06/2009 12:04): make sure it's exposed using the confluence1 prefix, see "confluence1.moveAttachment". If you exposed it separately, as an non-confluence compatible extension, it might be using some other prefix venkatesh - (29/06/2009 12:05): oh venkatesh - (29/06/2009 12:06): I think its confluene 2.0 specification. venkatesh - (29/06/2009 12:06): moveAttachment Enygma` - (29/06/2009 12:07): try playing with the prefix, it should be the cause of this. sdumitriu left at 12:07 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)) venkatesh - (29/06/2009 12:08): ok venkatesh - (29/06/2009 12:08): let me see arunreddy left at 12:08 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)) sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 12:11 sdumitriu left at 12:34 ("Leaving.") lucaa joined #xwiki at 12:55 tachirei joined #xwiki at 13:01 anamarias joined #xwiki at 13:07 venkatesh left at 13:11 () florinciu joined #xwiki at 13:43 tachirei left #xwiki at 13:47 sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 14:19 anamarias left at 14:59 () alexmaru joined #xwiki at 15:46 alexmaru left at 15:48 (Remote closed the connection) alexmaru joined #xwiki at 15:54 xwikibot joined #xwiki at 17:50 kaaloo left at 18:11 (Remote closed the connection) lucaa left #xwiki at 18:17 jvdrean left at 18:20 () alexmaru1 joined #xwiki at 18:25 mflorea left at 18:25 ("Leaving") jvelociter left at 18:29 () glerouge - (29/06/2009 18:32): jk\_work as of today, there's no such way that I know of glerouge - (29/06/2009 18:32): however we've been doing something similar for files in XWiki WOrkspaces glerouge - (29/06/2009 18:32): one document per uploaded file glerouge - (29/06/2009 18:32): thus you had comments for a given document glerouge - (29/06/2009 18:33): right now you have versioning for attached files and you could consider a page is the "folder" for those documents glerouge - (29/06/2009 18:33): that's what happens in practice in webdav view for instance glerouge left at 18:33 ("Gone chasing a unicorn in the twilight zone") alexmaru left at 18:42 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)) alexmaru1 left at 18:46 () alexmaru joined #xwiki at 18:46 jvdrean joined #xwiki at 18:58 tmortagne left at 18:59 ("Ex-Chat") KermitTheFragger left at 19:06 ("Leaving") anamarias left at 19:22 () cristinaS left at 19:29 (Read error: 60 (Operation timed out)) Enygma` left at 19:30 ("Leaving.") jk\_work\_ joined #xwiki at 19:42 jk\_work left at 19:58 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)) arunreddy\_ left at 20:07 (Read error: 110 (Connection timed out)) Enygma` joined #xwiki at 20:12 jk\_work\_ left at 20:20 () jvelociter joined #xwiki at 20:36 kaaloo joined #xwiki at 20:41 jk\_work joined #xwiki at 20:51 cristinaS joined #xwiki at 21:06 vmassol left at 21:23 () jvdrean left at 21:38 () cristinaS left at 21:40 ("Yummy, like ircing on a cake! [ http://www.bersirc.org/ - Open Source IRC ]") jk\_work left at 21:46 () alexmaru left at 22:01 () vmassol joined #xwiki at 22:03 lucaa1 joined #xwiki at 22:57 anamarias joined #xwiki at 23:01 huubert joined #xwiki at 23:09 huubert - (29/06/2009 23:09): Hi. huubert - (29/06/2009 23:10): Should this http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Snippets/ChildPageSnippet work with XWiki 1.9? huubert - (29/06/2009 23:10): It doesn't print anything for me. kaaloo left at 23:14 ("Leaving.") vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:22): huubert: this snippet is in xwiki syntax 1.0 vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:22): so make sure you choose the xwiki syntax 1.0 if you use it vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:23): we need to convert all our snippets docs to mention the syntax they're using or show how to write them in both syntaxes vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:23): this is a work in progress vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:23): it's only since XWIki 1.9 that we're using the xwiki syntax 2.0 by default huubert - (29/06/2009 23:24): vmassol: I have saved the page with xwiki syntax 1.0. vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:24): huubert: ok then it's something else vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:24): have you installed the plugin mentioned? huubert - (29/06/2009 23:25): Oh! :-) huubert - (29/06/2009 23:25): I didn't read that. huubert - (29/06/2009 23:25): Sorry. vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:25): :) huubert - (29/06/2009 23:28): I can't find a download on the plugin page: http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Plugins/DocumentTreePlugin vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:29): huubert: try again vmassol - (29/06/2009 23:29): I don't know why, this download like disappears from time to time huubert - (29/06/2009 23:30): Thanks. huubert - (29/06/2009 23:32): I will try that tomorrow. huubert - (29/06/2009 23:32): :-) huubert left #xwiki at 23:32 lucaa1 left at 23:51 ("Leaving.") sdumitriu left at 23:53 ("Leaving.")
